title: Midalee
body:
{{champion:76}} 

Best way to play Nida mid?

replies.body: {{champion:142}}

What bothers me is that they nerfed the hell out of nida and elise toplane yet allowed jayce to prosper.

They have the exact same playstyle in the lane ffs...

> [{quoted}](name=KnightLakega,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ya2aY6XH,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-12-14T20:54:56.620+0000)
>
> Isn't it great they gutted Nidalee's spear because "severely high damage skills coming from the fog of war is not fun or engaging, and creates very little potential for outplays".. 
> 
> Then they create this toxic pile.. {{champion:142}}

it'd still be a great way to learn by having a similar because they both have one main skill shot
go back 6 seasons

Midalee is great IF you can hit your Q spears which can be pretty tough in a lane. I haven't played her in a while but I have 350k mastery points on her and a lot of those were in the mid lane, don't let anyone say you can't take nidalee mid... Just hit them Q's

> [{quoted}](name=e46 Fanatic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ya2aY6XH,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2019-12-15T20:35:09.494+0000)
>
> Midalee is great IF you can hit your Q spears which can be pretty tough in a lane. I haven't played her in a while but I have 350k mastery points on her and a lot of those were in the mid lane, don't let anyone say you can't take nidalee mid... Just hit them Q's

You CAN, and some do play her top. Mid is just super not ideal. If you're looking to have fun and enjoy it, then by all means. But it's probably not something you want to focus on learning if you're also focusing on climbing/improving elsewhere.

One thing to consider any time you pick her is also that you're not really bringing any utility to the team, so you should ask if your team can handle that when picking her.

> [{quoted}](name=Beerstein,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ya2aY6XH,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2019-12-15T20:43:45.584+0000)
>
>  But it's probably not something you want to focus on learning if you're also focusing on climbing/improving elsewhere.

idk man playing nid mid helped me to learn player's pathing patterns around minions(because it's absolutely necessary when playing nid mid) and because of this I can't even count how many times I've been called a cheater for my nid Q's(though my sidestep predictions are even better), something that messes a LOT of people up is them thinking "oh hey thats not ideal for easy gameplay" when they should be thinking "there's a lot to learn from a tough situation"... kinda like how if I wanted to, I could go pick a pro build that recommends me build Merc Treads(because it's ideal) even though I'm playing against a full Basic attack team, people need to quit taking advice from people who are scared to cope and learn

> [{quoted}](name=e46 Fanatic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ya2aY6XH,comment-id=000a00000000,timestamp=2019-12-15T22:01:43.084+0000)
>
> idk man playing nid mid helped me to learn player's pathing patterns around minions(because it's absolutely necessary when playing nid mid) and because of this I can't even count how many times I've been called a cheater for my nid Q's(though my sidestep predictions are even better), something that messes a LOT of people up is them thinking "oh hey thats not ideal for easy gameplay" when they should be thinking "there's a lot to learn from a tough situation"... kinda like how if I wanted to, I could go pick a pro build that recommends me build Merc Treads(because it's ideal) even though I'm playing against a full Basic attack team, people need to quit taking advice from people who are scared to cope and learn

I meant more global knowledge, I'd say she's also great for refining last hitting due to her smol pokes.

Could also be a good transition for people not comfortable with melee champions due to her cougar form.

One thing pretty much everyone recommends against is focusing on learning champions that can be a bit harder/more complex when there's a lot of more basic external knowledge that can be more impactful like positioning, warding, lane freezes, positioning for global objectives etc.

When you start focusing too much on your screen/mastering a champion you aren't able to pick up the big picture as easily, which is why people usually recommend more basic champions for people trying to learn. Not because they can't learn the champion, but because they should focus on other concepts first which will benefit them more.

It kinda goes along with how if someone is high enough, they can play any champion with really whack builds in any position no matter how ridiculous and win, it isn't coming from the champion at that point, but mostly from game knowledge.

I once played Nami mid into a Nida, each time she'd W aggressively she'd land on a bubble, I killed her like 10 times I swear xDD But anyways, she can't land spears so good in lane and she really won't have priority either cuz she has little wave clear, you'd have to rely more on traps to mark them so you can all in with cougar form but you'd fight in their waves more often then not if you do that. I don't recommend her on mid lane. You could however try her in the bot lane as support.
Surrender at 15
Ban her in champ select and pick Yasuo

> [{quoted}](name=lunarcana,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ya2aY6XH,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-12-14T20:15:11.197+0000)
>
> {{champion:76}} 
> 
> Best way to play Nida mid?

You don't. A huge chunk of your kit is completely useless in lane.

Find an legacy server that is on any patch befor V5.2

And once you ever do find such an legacy server, please post it to share the happiness{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
You take smite and farm jungle camps ;3

Thanks for the responses already;

I get that it's not ideal in-lane, but I like playing her as a full AP carry and I dislike jungling (seems especially stressful this preseason), so from my pov (bronze) mid seems like it makes sense as a stand-in for other AP assassins if I win early and roam a lot midgame
I used to try it but I didn't do very well.  I had to max E first to survive Zed poke and take cull and some AD to last hit.

> [{quoted}](name=Reaper Soraka,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ya2aY6XH,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2019-12-15T05:11:46.908+0000)
>
> I used to try it but I didn't do very well.  I had to max E first to survive Zed poke and take cull and some AD to last hit.

Nid's always been harder than most to last hit with. Cull is never a bad buy if you can finish it and not get stomped though.
They removed cull
You dont
not worth it
Nida deserve qol as speed buff on her Q -  1300 -> 2000

> [{quoted}](name=HideSide,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ya2aY6XH,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2019-12-14T22:20:54.590+0000)
>
> Nida deserve qol as speed buff on her Q -  1300 -> 2000

Nid animation canceling makes her way too powerful for a buff. She's one of the strongest junglers right now, just requires so much skill to constantly animation cancel while also focusing on everything else that very few can play her well. As a former Nid main, I'm happy with where she is, even if I can't pull her off.

> [{quoted}](name=Beerstein,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ya2aY6XH,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2019-12-14T23:58:40.827+0000)
>
> Nid animation canceling makes her way too powerful for a buff. She's one of the strongest junglers right now, just requires so much skill to constantly animation cancel while also focusing on everything else that very few can play her well. As a former Nid main, I'm happy with where she is, even if I can't pull her off.

She isnt too powerful for a buff, not to even think that she is one of strongests, like there are other junglers that are way stronger...
For instance, my brother who was in d4 for a while plays nidalee a lot now and mained her back in s3, a lot, and when I see him play her, I see how much he has to compensate her small numbers with mechanics  and even with mechanics there are limits to what you can do, especially with her Q which has really tiny hitbox and quite small speed. If he mained rengar like me, all games would be different ( in his favor). Like, almost every jungler is stronger than nidalee in raw power and does not even require half the effort she needs to be pulled off... ( even evelynn who can hunt only "free" kills, so if she encounters dueler and dont kill him on combo, she herself will die)

Those 700 units of speed will only help to likelihood that she wont miss and thus lower effort one need to pull her off  at higher potential but wont change maximal potential itself. Thus everything you said is not only meaningless but also even disproved. Only valid thing you can say is that 2000 is too much...

> [{quoted}](name=HideSide,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ya2aY6XH,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2019-12-15T00:59:08.939+0000)

Thus everything you said is not only meaningless but also even disproved. Only valid thing you can say is that 2000 is too much...

Tell that to all the 60%+ win rate Nidalee mains in Diamond 2+

Before I get "Prove it" or some silly ass comment like that.

(I threw a few 70-80%+s at the top with not quite as many games just for shits.)

Neither of the lists are even close to complete. 

I see you're on EUNE, but as an overall, the win rates with her seem to on average be even higher there.

"My brother was Diamond 4 and played Nid in season 3" is hardly a sound argument. Also, relatively speaking, people weren't very good at the game in Season 3, and Nidalee was a way different Beastess. Canceling animations was only in its infancy at best at that time, which is what she excels at. Beyond that, many champions have in some way had that limited, Nidalee has not. You can literally cancel every single animation she has.
